Ad Text:
Join a fast-growing tech team developing cutting-edge software for smart manufacturing! Enjoy flexibility, innovation, and competitive rewards.

Our client is a leader in next-generation, smart composite materials and is at the forefront of innovation in the manufacturing sector. As they experience rapid expansion, they are looking for a Power Electronics Engineer to join their dynamic team in Canning Vale, W.A.

Role Overview:

You will need a strong foundation in power electronics engineering, with proven experience in high-power electronics design. Proficiency in DFM/DFA/DFS principles, power electronics simulation tools, structured problem-solving methodologies, experience in fast-paced innovative environments, along with the ability to balance competing priorities, will set you apart.

Requirements
         Investigate and resolve assigned power-related production and field non-conformances (NCR).
         Solve complex power electronics problems using Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA) etc.
         Lead continuous improvement methodologies (NSIS) to optimise power conversion efficiency and thermal management.
         Design and develop advanced low and high-voltage, high-power electronic systems, including inverters, converters, and power control circuits (1kW – 1MW).
         Implement, integrate, test, and debug complex power electronics components and systems.
         Select and specify power semiconductors, magnetic devices, capacitors, and power drive circuits for optimal performance and reliability.
         Utilise simulation tools such as MATLAB/Simulink, LTSpice, Simplorer, and Maxwell for power/frequency/integrity/thermal assessments.
         Design for EMC compliance, ensuring designs meet regulatory standards and certification requirements.
         Prototype and test high-power systems, performing real-time validation and field trials.
         Integrating electrical and electronic commodities within mechanical structures/enclosures.
 
Experience:
         IGBTs, MOSFETs, rectifier circuits, barrier diodes, magnetics, and power conversion devices.
         high-power electronics, inverter/converter design, and power circuit topologies.
         power electronics simulation tools (MATLAB/Simulink, LTSpice, Simplorer, Maxwell).
         DFM/DFA/DFS principles and high-volume manufacturing.
         circuit design software (e.g., ALTIUM) and CAD tools (e.g AutoCAD, SolidWorks etc).
         EMC test equipment and firmware development for 32-bit ARM micro-controllers (with and without RTOS).
         BMS platforms, CANbus communication, and control system integration.
         Power systems related documentation for building and site installation of products.
         power electronics, including rectifier circuits, IGBT, MOSFET, and power conversion devices
         Minimum 3-5 years of experience in an Electronics Industry especially in an R&D and manufacturing environment.
 
Skills:
         Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
         Strong analytical problem-solving and attention to detail.
         Ability to work independently and across multiple disciplines.
         Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work under pressure.
 
Qualifications:

Degree in Electrical & Electronics Engineering, Power Electronics Engineering or Equivalent.

If you are interested in this role, please send in an updated CV by Clicking the APPLY NOW Button

Join a fast-growing tech team developing cutting-edge software for smart manufacturing! Enjoy flexibility, innovation, and competitive rewards.

Join a fast-growing tech team developing cutting-edge software for smart manufacturing! Enjoy flexibility, innovation, and competitive rewards.

Our client is a leader in next-generation, smart composite materials and is at the forefront of innovation in the manufacturing sector. As they experience rapid expansion, they are looking for a Control Systems Engineer to join their dynamic team in Canning Vale, W.A.


Position Overview:

Control Systems Engineer to contribute to the development of innovative processing equipment. The Control Systems Engineer will play a pivotal role in the development and design of automated processes. 
Key Responsibilities:

Develop the process automation/control systems (including communication networks) hardware architecture - typically comprising of PLCs, safety controllers, functional safety field devices, variable speed drives, power generation and chemical (gas) processing equipment.
In conjunction with process specialists, design control schemes for new material processing lines, then build, test and operate these systems.
Assist in the development of new capabilities for control system design, testing, certification and production.
Develop, program and implement control systems and control strategies for process manufacturing applications, simulating and testing to ensuring stability and reliability.
Develop and maintain system documentation including functional specifications, design specifications, test plans, and operational manuals.
Provide technical support to development and operational teams during system development, commissioning, deployment and production.
Participate in the engineering peer group and exchange of ideas and feedback within the team.
Ensure all regulatory and safety requirements are met.
Stay up to date with the latest control systems technologies and industry trends.
Train staff in control systems functionality and troubleshooting.
Ensure the safety of all activities, including safety procedures and risk assessments for development and production activities.
Assist with submissions to all relevant certification authorities for approvals.
Establish systems and procedures for management of control system design data, in collaboration with control system engineers at other sites.
Assist in continually improving the output of the team.
Qualifications:
·         Bachelor of Electrical /Automation/Control Systems Engineering or equivalent.
Desirable:

·         Post-graduate degree or advanced qualifications in Control Systems, Industrial Control, Electrical, Mechatronics or Renewable Energy.
·         Experience with artificial intelligence / machine learning for intelligent control.
·         Experience in the new energy industry, manufacturing or research & development.
·         Functional Safety qualifications (i.e. TUV Certified Engineer).

   At least 3 years of automation/control systems engineering experience within a mining or industrial setting.

If you are interested in this role, please send in an updated CV by Clicking the APPLY NOW Button

Job Title: Data and Analytics Engineer - 12-month max. term contract
Ad Text:
Data and Analytics Engineer - 12-month max. term contract
  

Newly created role, leverage analytical and technical skills to implement innovative solutions.
Hybrid work environment, NFP salary packaging, and an opportunity to work with a passionate team and find meaningful work in a for-purpose organisation.
Salary on offer $120,000 + superannuation and access to NFP salary packaging.
  

About the role

Working closely in a small team and reporting into the Head of Data and Insights, you will design and deliver trusted, scalable data models and solutions enabling the organisation to make smarter, faster, and more impactful decisions.
  
You’ll be tasked with building robust integrations, pipelines, automating workflows, and enabling self-service analytics to ensure that high-quality data is accessible, reliable, and aligned to deliver on strategic objectives.
  
Role responsibilities:

Business partner internally to gather data/analytics requirements, and create technical solutions supporting data models, reports, automated workflows, and campaign activities.
Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines across systems of record (such as CRM) and an Azure Data Warehouse.
Collate data from CRM, finance, and fundraising systems into the Azure Data Lake and Data Warehouse.
Cleanse, normalise, and join datasets to create reusable data models and analytics-ready views of organisational data.
Leverage Azure Data Lake and related tools to support scalable data preparation and storage.
Use Python (including writing automation scripts), SQL, Power Automate, and/or KNIME to streamline workflows, automate recurring extracts and reporting, and reduce manual effort.
Develop APIs and integrations that connect internal systems, and the data warehouse seamlessly.
Create reusable data models and semantic layers that power self-service analytics and consistent reporting. Define key metrics and build dashboards in BI tools to drive better decisions.
Support data retrievals for campaign analytics (target audience lists, response tracking, ROI measurement, etc).
Conduct data quality checks, deduplication processes, metadata management, and security standards to ensure reliable, trusted data.
 
Essential criteria:
  
You’ll thrive when collaborating and designing sophisticated solutions for existing issues and architecture, and be comfortable in a fast-paced and fluid environment.
  
Previous experience in the for-purpose sector will be highly regarded but transferrable industry experience (e.g., Telecommunications, Sales, FMCG, or similar sectors) will also be welcomed.

A Bachelor’s degree in Data Engineering, Data Science, or a related field as well as experience in a hybrid data engineering/analytics engineering role.
Exceptional SQL skills, experience with ETL and data transformation tools (e.g., dbt, Alteryx, custom scripts, or similar).
Proven experience with Python (or another scripting language) for automation.
Experience with at least one Data Warehouse platform (e.g., Azure SQL/Synapse, Redshift, or BigQuery), as well as experience working with CRM platforms and related data models.
Strong experience working with at least one BI tool (Power BI preferred but can also be Tableau or Looker).
Ability to bridge engineering and business systems as well as implement data quality checks, metadata management, or data governance practices.
  
How to Apply

To be considered for this position please apply now with your resume directly through the advertisement. If you have any further questions, please contact Diana Linde at diana@beaumontpeople.com.au.
  
Applications will be assessed as they arrive, please apply immediately if you are interested.

At Beaumont People we believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way.  We encourage applications from people of all different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from CALD backgrounds and people with disabilities.
  
We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to be made for your application to be assessed we would be more than happy to discuss how that can be arranged.

The Role 


We are seeking a Systems Integration Engineer (Level 3) with a background in Mechanical, Electrical, or Mechatronic Engineering and demonstrated expertise in communications systems integration. 


In this role, you will contribute to the delivery of complex, multi-domain engineering projects, providing technical leadership, system integration expertise, and support through all phases of the engineering lifecycle — from requirements analysis to verification and certification. 


Qualifications 


Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Mechatronic, or related discipline). 

Postgraduate qualifications (Master’s or PhD) highly regarded. 


The Job


Interpret user and stakeholder requirements to develop integrated C4I or systems engineering concepts. 

Review mechanical and electrical designs, technical drawings, and specifications to provide subject matter expertise and recommendations. 

Develop and execute elements of the Engineering Management Plan, including Technical Certification Plans, Safety Cases, and supporting documentation. 

Contribute to technical certification processes and engineering change management activities. 

Audit existing configurations and ensure design compliance with applicable standards and specifications. 

Support implementation, rollout, and testing activities to verify conformance with approved designs. 

Conduct requirements analysis, traceability, and management. 

Lead system design, development, and integration activities. 

Execute verification, validation, and certification (V&V) processes. 

Plan and deliver engineering services that meet technical and regulatory requirements. 

Review technical deliverables and provide engineering assessments to support decision-making.


 


About You 


You are a proactive and detail-oriented engineer who thrives in complex, cross-functional environments. You take ownership of technical outcomes, demonstrate sound judgement, and are committed to delivering high-quality engineering solutions. 


You will bring: 


At least 5 years of relevant industry experience delivering engineering services in a systems or integration environment. 

Strong experience in system-level engineering, including requirements definition, hazard analysis, certification, and documentation. 

Proven ability to produce clear and comprehensive design documentation and technical reports. 

Understanding of capability integration principles and frameworks (e.g. operational, technical, and organisational). 

Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills. 

Ability to manage risk, priorities, and technical delivery within complex project structures. 

Tertiary qualifications or relevant experience in Engineering within Defence or a similarly regulated environment. 

Proven experience delivering complex integration projects. 

Experience working in logistically and technically demanding environments. 

Ability to lead technical integration activities and collaborate across multi-disciplinary teams. 

Current or ability to obtain an NV1 Security Clearance


Next Steps? 


If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, please send through your updated CV to MirandaC@Humanresources.com.au or call 075507 7759 for a confidential conversation.

Our Fin serviced client is looking for a talented Solution Architect to join our team, serving as the primary driver of our architectural strategy across traditional applications, LLMs, and AI.

In this role you’ll be the last line of defence, making sure all applications are secure by design.

Understand the Landscape: Gain a full view of our tech and app ecosystem and assess it for security risks.
Lead Security Efforts: Provide hands-on cybersecurity guidance in Agile teams across Digital.
Embed Best Practice: Build and integrate strong security processes into the SDLC for all teams.
Design Secure Architectures: Plan and develop robust, scalable security patterns for projects.
Manage Vulnerabilities: Proactively find, prioritise, and remediate issues across code and infrastructure.
Automate Security: Integrate SAST, DAST, and other checks into CI/CD pipelines for early detection.
Secure AI Systems: Address unique risks in LLMs and Gen AI such as prompt injection and data poisoning.
Run Assessments: Lead regular scans, risk analyses, and security reviews; share findings with product teams.
Educate Teams: Research standards and protocols, then coach developers on secure practices.
Align with Policy: Work with Cyber Security and the business to apply policies, log risks, and maintain compliance.
Respond to Incidents: Act fast on threats, manage escalations, and deliver post-incident reports.
Partner with Vendors: Help select and implement security tools and solutions.
Promote Awareness: Drive security training and education programs for developers and digital teams.
About YOU

You’re a results-driven security professional with strong expertise in both application and cloud security. You have:

Experience: Proven track record as an Application Security Engineer or similar role.
Technical Skills: In-depth knowledge of web and cloud vulnerabilities (e.g., OWASP Top 10) and hands-on experience with security testing tools and methodologies.
Cloud Security: Strong experience with GCP, including IAM, network security, and data protection.
Problem-Solving: Analytical and proactive in identifying and mitigating complex security threats.
Communication: Excellent interpersonal skills, able to influence and collaborate with engineering teams across the organization.
Please contact kate@correlateresources.com if you are interested in this role!

Job Title: Senior AI / Machine Learning Engineer – Leading Finance Organization
Salary: Great Salary plus a bonus of up to 15% on top
Ad Text:
Join a fast-moving financial services organisation as a Senior AI / Machine Learning Engineer, where you’ll design and deliver advanced AI systems that create meaningful impact across digital experiences, customer touchpoints, fraud detection, and operational automation.


You’ll work alongside talented Engineers and Data Scientists to shape and deliver AI-driven solutions that enhance customer experience, digital channels, and operational efficiency — delivering tangible, measurable outcomes for the business.

Why Join?

Award Winning Finance Organization, with a supportive culture
Clear career development plans to support your continual growth
Collaborative, forward-thinking culture with genuine career acceleration
Innovative, passionate team that values technical excellence and continuous learning
Hybrid and flexible working arrangements

Technical Experience

Strong Python (async, production-grade), PyTorch, TensorFlow
GenAI and NLP: LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI
Microservices, REST APIs, event-driven systems
Hands-on experience with Generative and Agentic AI projects

Bonus Skills

Experience applying Generative and Agentic AI to voice recognition, digital CX automation, call deflection, or intelligent routing
Real-time NLP, voice-to-text, and CRM or customer journey integrations

If you’re ready to build AI systems that redefine how customers engage across digital channels, we’d love to hear from you.
Interviews happening next week.
For a confidential discussion, text Anna-Maria on 0426 503 822 and I will get back to you.
